# üóìÔ∏è Conference Organizing Master Checklist

---

## üö© Milestone 1: Ways of Working
*Goal: Establish the principles and operations logistics of the organizing committee.*

- [ ] **Team Setup**
    - [ ] Confirm functional leads (e.g., Technical/GitHub Lead, Program Lead).
    - [ ] Confirm `TEAM.md` roles and responsibilities.
        - [ ] **Confirm Chair:** Responsible for overall vision, high-level partnerships, and presiding over meetings.
        - [ ] **Confirm Secretary:** Responsible for the Comms Playbook, documentation, meeting notes, and internal coordination.
        - [ ] **Confirm Treasurer:** Responsible for the budget, fundraising, sponsorships, and processing reimbursements.
        - [ ] **Confirm Local Liaison:** Responsible for physical venue liaison, local vendor management, and on-site logistics.
        - [ ] **Confirm other roles and responsibilities as required**
    - [ ] Confirm communication channels for organisers (internal).
    - [ ] Collate organiser contact information and PIDs (Secretary to lead).
- [ ] **Infrastructure**
    - [ ] Ensure all organisers have tech-stack access/accounts
    - [ ] Set up "Organisers Briefing Doc" with quick-links to directories
    - [ ] Decide on other participant contribution routes (e.g., add to `CONTRIBUTING.md`)
- [ ] **Governance & Documentation (Secretary Lead)**
    - [ ] Document Purpose and Values of all partners/collaborators
    - [ ] Document decision-making process (Transparency vs. Privacy)
    - [ ] Document collaboration tech-stack (Storage, PM tool, Meeting tools)
    - [ ] Document meeting schedule and templates (Sync vs. Async expectations)
    - [ ] Document conflict resolution and feedback management methods
- [ ] **Fundraising & Strategy (Treasurer Lead)**
    - [ ] Identify total budget required vs. currently secured funds
    - [ ] Create a list of potential sponsors, partners, or grant bodies
    - [ ] Draft a "Sponsorship Prospectus" (1-pager) outlining the event value and partner benefits
- [ ] **Comms Playbook & Strategy**
    - [ ] Define advertising channels (e.g. Social Media, Newsletters, Slack, Community Lists)
    - [ ] Map "Who advertises where" (Allocation of responsibilities)
    - [ ] Establish a Comms Timeline (Launch date, weekly reminders, "Last Call" countdown)
    - [ ] Create Copy bank for partners to use for promotion

---

## üö© Milestone 2: Pre-Launch & Call for Submissions
*Goal: Define the event and prepare for submissions.*

- [ ] **Strategic Definition (Chair Lead)**
    - [ ] Define event purpose, objectives, and success metrics
    - [ ] **Capacity Planning:** Determine target participant numbers (min/max) and hybrid ratio
    - [ ] Define target attendee list and appropriate advertising venues
- [ ] **Sponsorship Management (Treasurer Lead)**
    - [ ] Formalize sponsorship tiers and partner deliverables
    - [ ] Set up tracking for outreach and confirmed pledges
    - [ ] Finalize invoicing and payment collection process
    - [ ] Agree pricing and bursary structures
- [ ] **Event Logistics (Local Liaison Lead)**
    - [ ] Finalize event date and draft agenda
    - [ ] Book physical location (if in-person/hybrid)
    - [ ] Identify financial support limits (scholarships/travel grants)
    - [ ] Identify accessibility/support offerings (Quiet rooms, childcare, captions)
- [ ] **Public Presence & Application**
    - [ ] Write short description for ads and draft templates (Short vs. Long form)
    - [ ] Set up advertising webpage (GitHub Pages, Luma, etc.)
    - [ ] Create and open Participant Application Form
- [ ] **Review Readiness**
    - [ ] Document application assessment rubric/scoring system
    - [ ] Finalize Comms schedule against application deadlines

---

## üö© Milestone 3: Selection & Communications Sprint
*Goal: Reviewing applicants and securing the logistics*

- [ ] **Outreach & Review**
    - [ ] Disseminate call per Comms Playbook
    - [ ] Run application reminders per Secretary's timeline
    - [ ] Close applications and run review process
- [ ] **Tech stack**
    - [ ] Set up online meeting platform (Zoom, etc.)
    - [ ] Create collaborative participant note templates
- [ ] **Registration & Logistics**
    - [ ] Create registration page
    - [ ] **Local Liaison:** Collate travel/meal/accommodation preferences
    - [ ] **Treasurer:** Book hotels/travel or set up reimbursement pipeline
    - [ ] Double-check details/itineraries with each participant

---

## üö© Milestone 4: The Onboarding & Execution Phase
*Goal: Preparing participants and running the event.*

- [ ] **Onboarding (Pre-Event)**
    - [ ] Send selection/unselection emails
    - [ ] Launch Slack/Email chain for registered participants
    - [ ] Run tech stack onboarding calls for presenters
    - [ ] Share final agenda and prerequisites
- [ ] **During the Event**
    - [ ] Coordinate with local vendors (Local Liaison)
    - [ ] Host "Community Share-out" and collect feedback

---

## üö© Milestone 5: Post-Event Wrap-up & Legacy
*Goal: Reporting, gratitude, and data migration.*

- [ ] **Participant Follow-up**
    - [ ] Send thank you emails to all attendees
    - [ ] Move bio/highlights to Contributors Record
- [ ] **Reporting & Records**
    - [ ] Develop final report with highlights on GitHub
    - [ ] **Treasurer:** Close the books and finalize all reimbursements
- [ ] **Internal Closure**
    - [ ] Set up debrief meeting with the planning committee
    - [ ] Send thank you notes/packages to the committee members
